title: Problem 2085_B
statement: You are given an array a consisting of n≥ 4 non-negative integers.You need to perform the following operation on a until its length becomes 1: Select two indices l and r (1≤ {\color{red}{ l < r }} ≤ |a|), and replace the subarray [a_l,a_{l+1},...,a_r] with a single integer \operatorname{mex}([a_l,a_{l+1},...,a_r]), where \operatorname{mex}(b) denotes the minimum excluded (MEX)^{\text{∗}} of the integers in b. In other words, let x=\operatorname{mex}([a_l,a_{l+1},...,a_r]), the array a will becom
